alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 09 at 6:20PM MST until August 09 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Western Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... Southeastern Imperial County in southeastern California... * Until 700 PM MST/700 PM PDT/. * At 620 PM MST/620 PM PDT/, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 27 miles northeast of Brawley to 10 miles north of Algodones Dunes to near Gordon's Well, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 1 and 2. CA Interstate 8 between mile markers 78 and 96. CA Route 78 between mile markers 42 and 55. Locations impacted include... Yuma, Winterhaven, Algodones Dunes and Andrade. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
